Unlikely, at least for a pure bruiser.

Supports need to either have enhancements, damage threat, or significant crowd control. They also need to scale well without gold being as important to that scaling.

Making a support bruiser that could be a threat without being impossible to balance for a solo lane looks incredibly difficult.

Oddities like {{champion:555}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:3}} are about as close as one can get.
{{champion:44}} with his enchaned auto attacks and strong in combat sustain.
Just build {{item:3025}}  on him and you have yourself a bruiser who can 1v1 a lot of assassins and fighters on a support's income.

No, it cannot. Bruisers are notable for being melee, having little to no CC, but high damage and decent defensive stats, and relatively low mobility. The very core of their class is an anathema to the support role, and I don't believe the two extremes can be made to coexist in the same champion. You'd basically be making a tank support with high damage if you  tried to make a bruiser support.
{{champion:48}} Riot always ends up nerfing him for it though.
